longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to make provisions in respect of patents and related matters.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Patents Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: ApplicationForAPatent,PatentApplication
def.leadIn: application for a patent (專利的申請) and patent application (專利申請) mean—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for a standard patent (R);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application for a standard patent (O); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an application for a short-term patent; (Added 17 of 2016 s. 5)

def.name: ApplicationForAPatentOrOtherProtection
def.leadIn: application for a patent or other protection (專利或其他保護的申請) means an application for any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a patent;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registration of a utility model;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a utility certificate;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an inventor’s certificate; (Added 17 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.def: application for a short-term patent (短期專利的申請) and short-term patent application (短期專利申請) mean an application under Part 15 for a short-term patent; (Added 17 of 2016 s. 5)

def.name: ApplicationForAStandardPatent,StandardPatentApplication
def.leadIn: application for a standard patent (標準專利的申請) and standard patent application (標準專利申請) mean—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for a standard patent (R); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application for a standard patent (O); (Added 17 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.def: application for a standard patent (O) (原授標準專利的申請) and standard patent (O) application (原授標準專利申請) mean an application under Part 3 for a standard patent (O); (Added 17 of 2016 s. 5)
certificate of substantive examination (實質審查證明書) means a certificate issued by the Registrar under section 127F in respect of a short-term patent; (Added 17 of 2016 s. 5)
court (法院) means the Court of First Instance; (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

def.name: DateOfFiling
def.leadIn: date of filing (提交日期)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a request to record or a request for registration and grant, means the date which is the date of filing that request by virtue of section 17 or 24 respectively;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an application for a standard patent (R), has the meaning specified in relation to that term in section 3(ii); (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 5)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a designated patent application, means the date specified as such in the designated patent application;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to an application for a standard patent (O), means the date of filing accorded in accordance with section 37M; (Added 17 of 2016 s. 5)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in relation to an application for a short-term patent, means the date of filing accorded in accordance with section 114; (Added 17 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.def: Doha Declaration (《多哈宣言》) means the Declaration on the TRIPS Agreement and Public Health adopted on 14 November 2001 by the Fourth WTO Ministerial Conference at Doha, Qatar; (Added 21 of 2007 s. 3)

def.name: EligibleImportingMember
def.leadIn: eligible importing member (合資格進口成員地) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a WTO member country, territory or area recognized by the United Nations as being a least-developed country; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other WTO member country, territory or area that has given notice in writing to the TRIPS Council that it intends to import pharmaceutical products in accordance with the General Council Decision or the Protocol; (Added 21 of 2007 s. 3)

subsection.def: employee (僱員) means a person who works or (where the employment has ceased) worked under a contract of employment (whether with the Government or with any other person);
employer (僱主), in relation to an employee, means the person by whom the employee is or was employed;

exclusive licence (專用特許) means a licence from the proprietor of or applicant for a patent conferring on the licensee, or on him and persons authorized by him, to the exclusion of all other persons (including the proprietor or applicant), any right in respect of the invention to which the patent or application for a patent relates, and exclusive licensee (專用特許持有人) and non-exclusive licence (非專用特許) shall be construed accordingly;

exporting member (出口成員地) means a WTO member country, territory or area that makes a patented pharmaceutical product for export to an eligible importing member in accordance with the General Council Decision or the Protocol; (Added 21 of 2007 s. 3)

General Council Decision (《總理事會決定》) means the Decision adopted by the General Council of the WTO on 30 August 2003 on the Implementation of Paragraph 6 of the Doha Declaration; (Added 21 of 2007 s. 3)
international application (國際申請) means an international application for a patent made under the Patent Cooperation Treaty;

International Bureau (國際局) means the International Bureau of Intellectual Property provided for under the Convention Establishing the World Intellectual Property Organization signed at Stockholm on 14 July 1967;

def.name: LawOfTheDesignatedPatentOffice
def.leadIn: law of the designated patent office (指定專利當局的法律) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a designated patent office established under the law of any country, territory or area other than Hong Kong, the law of that country, territory or area;

paragraph.name: b

def.name: MaterialDate
def.leadIn: material date (關鍵日期) means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: for a standard patent (R), the deemed date of filing of the application for the patent or, if priority is claimed, the date of priority;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a standard patent (O) application, the date of filing of the application or, if priority is claimed, the date of priority;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for a standard patent (O), the date of filing of the application for the patent or, if priority is claimed, the date of priority;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: for a short-term patent application, the date of filing of the application or, if priority is claimed, the date of priority;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: for a short-term patent, the date of filing of the application for the patent or, if priority is claimed, the date of priority; (Added 17 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.def: mortgage (按揭) when used as a noun, includes a charge for securing money or money’s worth and, when used as a verb, shall be construed accordingly;

non-prejudicial disclosure (不具損害性的披露) means, in relation to an invention, a disclosure of the invention which is not to be taken into consideration for the purposes of determining whether or not the invention forms part of the state of the art;
official journal (官方公報) means the publication for the time being specified under section 150A as the official journal of record; (Added 2 of 2001 s. 2)

opposition or revocation proceedings (反對或撤銷專利的法律程序) means, in relation to a designated patent, proceedings under the law of the designated patent office providing for the revocation or amendment of the designated patent within a specified period after the grant;
Paris Convention (《巴黎公約》) means the Convention for the Protection of Industrial Property signed at Paris on 20 March 1883, as revised or amended from time to time; (Amended 2 of 2001 s. 2)

def.name: ParisConventionCountry
def.leadIn: Paris Convention country (巴黎公約國) means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: any territory or area subject to the authority or under the suzerainty of any country specified in Schedule 1 pursuant to paragraph (a), or any territory or area administered by any such country, on behalf of which such country has acceded to the Paris Convention;

subsection.def: Patent Cooperation Treaty (《專利合作條約》) means the treaty of that name done at Washington on 19 June 1970, as revised or amended from time to time; (Amended 2 of 2001 s. 2)
patented invention (專利發明) means an invention for which a standard patent or, as the case may be, a short-term patent is granted and patented process (專利方法) shall be construed accordingly;

def.name: PatentedPharmaceuticalProduct
def.leadIn: patented pharmaceutical product (專利藥劑製品) means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in relation to a process for which a standard patent or a short-term patent (as the case may be) has been granted, a pharmaceutical product obtained directly by means of the process or to which the process has been applied; (Added 21 of 2007 s. 3)

def.name: PatentedProduct
def.leadIn: patented product (專利產品) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a product which is an invention for which a standard patent or a short-term patent (as the case may be) has been granted;

paragraph.name: b

def.name: PharmaceuticalProduct
def.leadIn: pharmaceutical product (藥劑製品) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a pharmaceutical product within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Pharmacy and Poisons Ordinance (Cap. 138);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an active ingredient that is needed for making of a pharmaceutical product mentioned in paragraph (a); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a diagnostic kit that is needed for the use of a pharmaceutical product mentioned in paragraph (a); (Added 21 of 2007 s. 3)

subsection.def: prescribed (訂明) means prescribed or provided for by rules made under section 149;
protected layout-design (topography) (受保護的布圖設計(拓撲圖)) has the meaning assigned to that term by section 2(1) of the Layout-design (Topography) of Integrated Circuits Ordinance (Cap. 445);

Protocol (《日內瓦議定書》) means the Protocol Amending the TRIPS Agreement adopted by the General Council of the WTO at Geneva on 6 December 2005, the Annex to the Protocol Amending the TRIPS Agreement, the Annex to the TRIPS Agreement and the Appendix to the Annex to the TRIPS Agreement; (Added 21 of 2007 s. 3)

def.name: Register
def.leadIn: register (註冊紀錄冊、註冊)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as a noun, means the register of patents kept under section 51; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as a verb, means, in relation to any thing, to register or register particulars, or enter notice of that thing in the register and, in relation to a person, means to enter his name in the register,

def.continued: and cognate expressions shall be construed accordingly;

subsection.def: Registrar (處長) means the Registrar of Patents;
Registrar of Patents (專利註冊處處長) means the person holding that office by virtue of the Director of Intellectual Property (Establishment) Ordinance (Cap. 412);

def.name: RelevantInstrumentOrLegislation
def.leadIn: relevant instrument or legislation (有關文書或法例) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the General Council Decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Protocol; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: legislation made by the exporting member or the eligible importing member, as the case may be, pursuant to or for the purpose of implementing—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the General Council Decision; or

subparagraph.name: ii

subsection.def: request for registration and grant (註冊與批予請求) means a request under section 23 for the registration of a designated patent and the grant of a standard patent (R) for the invention shown in the published specification of the designated patent; (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 5)
request to record (記錄請求) means a request under section 15 to record a designated patent application;

right (權利), in relation to any patent or patent application, includes an interest in the patent or application and, without prejudice to the foregoing, any reference to a right in a patent includes a reference to a share in the patent;
short-term patent (短期專利) means a patent for an invention granted under Part 15; (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 5)

specification (說明書), in relation to an application for a patent under this Ordinance, a designated patent application or an international application, means the description, claims and drawings contained in the application;

def.name: StandardPatent
def.leadIn: standard patent (標準專利) means— (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a standard patent (R); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a standard patent (O); (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.def: standard patent (O) (原授標準專利) means a patent for an invention granted under Part 3; (Added 17 of 2016 s. 5)
standard patent (R) (轉錄標準專利) means a patent for an invention granted under Part 2; (Added 17 of 2016 s. 5)

def.name: SubstantiveExamination
def.leadIn: substantive examination (實質審查) means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: for a short-term patent, an examination of the patent under Division 5 of Part 15; (Added 17 of 2016 s. 5)

subsection.def: TRIPS Agreement (《知識產權協議》) means the Agreement on Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights, being Annex 1C of the World Trade Organisation Agreement; (Added 21 of 2007 s. 3)
TRIPS Council (知識產權理事會) means the Council for Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights referred to in Article 68 of the TRIPS Agreement; (Added 21 of 2007 s. 3)
verified copy (核實副本) means, in relation to a document, a copy verified in the prescribed manner;
World Trade Organisation Agreement (《世界貿易組織協議》) means the agreement of that name done at Marrakesh in 1994, as revised or amended from time to time; (Amended 2 of 2001 s. 2)
WTO (世界貿易組織) means the World Trade Organisation established in Geneva on 1 January 1995 under the World Trade Organisation Agreement; (Added 21 of 2007 s. 3)

WTO member country, territory or area (世界貿易組織成員國、地區或地方) means any country, territory or area for the time being specified in Schedule 1 as being a country, territory or area which has acceded to the World Trade Organisation Agreement.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Meaning of application for a standard patent (R) and standard patent (R) application
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires, reference to an application for a standard patent (R) or a standard patent (R) application is a reference to proceedings under Part 2— (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under sections 15 to 22 to record a designated patent application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under sections 23 to 27 for the registration of a designated patent and the grant of a standard patent (R) for the invention shown in the published specification of the designated patent,

section.continued: up to but not including the grant of the standard patent (R), and cognate expressions shall be construed accordingly; and reference to— (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 6)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the filing of an application for a standard patent (R) or a standard patent (R) application is a reference to the filing of a request to record;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the date of filing an application for a standard patent (R) or a standard patent (R) application is a reference to the date of filing a request to record;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: an application for a standard patent (R) or a standard patent (R) application as filed is a reference to a request to record as filed;

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: the publication of an application for a standard patent (R) or a standard patent (R) application is a reference to the publication of a request to record;

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: an invention which is the subject of an application for a standard patent (R) or a standard patent (R) application, or an invention in respect of which an application for a standard patent (R) or a standard patent (R) application has been made, is a reference to the invention disclosed in the specification of the corresponding designated patent or, if no request for registration and grant has been filed in the application, of the designated patent application;

paragraph.name: vi
paragraph.content: the specification of an application for a standard patent (R) or a standard patent (R) application is a reference to the specification of the corresponding designated patent application.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Meaning of designated patent, etc.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: designated patent (指定專利) means a patent granted by a designated patent office;

def.name: DesignatedPatentApplication
def.leadIn: designated patent application (指定專利申請) means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: an international application which has been published and which has validly entered its national phase in a designated patent office;

subsection.def: designated patent office (指定專利當局) means a patent office designated for the purpose of this Ordinance under section 8.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires, a reference—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: to a “corresponding designated patent” in relation to a standard patent (R), is a reference to the designated patent which was registered under section 27 in an application for the grant of the standard patent (R);

def.name: CorrespondingDesignatedPatentApplication
def.leadIn: to a “corresponding designated patent application”—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in relation to an application for a standard patent (R) for an invention, is a reference to the designated patent application in respect of that invention;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in relation to a standard patent (R), is a reference to the designated patent application in pursuance of which the corresponding designated patent was granted. (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 7)

section.name: s5
section.heading: Meaning of published

def.name: Published
def.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: published (發表) means made available to the public (whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a document shall be taken to be published under any provision of this Ordinance if it can be inspected as of right at any place in Hong Kong by members of the public, whether on payment of a fee or not.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to subsection (1), and unless the context otherwise requires, a reference in this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the grant of a standard patent (R) being published is a reference to its being published under section 27; (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 8)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a request to record being published is a reference to its being published under section 20;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to a designated patent being published is a reference to its being published by the designated patent office by which the patent was granted for the purposes of the law of that office relating to applications for and the granting of patents;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: to a designated patent application being published is a reference—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: except as provided in subparagraph (ii), to its being published by the designated patent office in which the application was made;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a designated patent application based on an international application, to the international application being published by the International Bureau under the Patent Cooperation Treaty, or by the designated patent office in which the application was made, whichever is the earlier;

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: to a standard patent (O) application being published is a reference to its being published under section 37Q; (Added 17 of 2016 s. 8)

paragraph.name: db
paragraph.content: to the grant of a standard patent (O) being published is a reference to its being published under section 37X; (Added 17 of 2016 s. 8)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to a short-term patent being published is a reference to its being published under section 118.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Other references

subsection.content: Unless the context otherwise requires, a reference in this Ordinance to a patent is a reference to a standard patent or a short-term patent granted under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Unless the context otherwise requires, a reference in this Ordinance to an international agreement is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: any instrument made under any such agreement to provide for amendment to or supplementation of the agreement.

subsection.content: Unless the context otherwise requires, a reference in this Ordinance to an enactment or law of a country, territory or area other than Hong Kong shall be construed as a reference to that enactment or law as it may from time to time be amended or extended by or under any other enactment or law of the country, territory or area.

Unless the context otherwise requires, a reference in this Ordinance to an invention being worked in Hong Kong includes a reference to the invention being worked by importation into Hong Kong for the purpose of putting the patented product on the market or stocking it for that purpose.

For the purposes of this Ordinance, a matter shall be taken to have been disclosed in any designated patent application or standard patent (O) application, or in the specification of a patent or a designated patent, if it was either claimed or disclosed (otherwise than by way of disclaimer or acknowledgment of prior art) in any such application or specification. (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 9)

section.name: s7
section.heading: Provisions regarding filing of documents, etc.
section.content: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires, a reference providing for the filing of any document with the Registrar shall be deemed to include a reference requiring the payment of any fee that may be prescribed for the filing of that document, and a document shall be deemed not to be duly filed for the purposes of this Ordinance unless any such fee as may be prescribed for the filing of the document is paid as so prescribed.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Designation of patent offices
section.text: The Chief Executive in Council may for the purposes of this Ordinance by notice published in the Gazette designate a patent office established under the law of any country, territory or area other than Hong Kong or established under any international agreement.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Special provision regarding invention covered by 2 or more patents
section.content: Where there are in effect 2 or more patents for the same invention, any use of the invention which does not constitute an infringement of any one such patent (whether by virtue of consent given by the proprietor, a compulsory licence having effect under Part 8, the provisions of Part 9 relating to Government use, an import compulsory licence having effect under Part 9A or an export compulsory licence having effect under Part 9B) shall not constitute an infringement of the other such patent.

part.name: P1A
part.heading: Patentability, Right to Patent and Mention of Inventor

section.name: s9A
section.heading: Patentable inventions

subsection.leadIn: An invention is patentable if it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is new;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: involves an inventive step; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is susceptible of industrial application.

subsection.leadIn: The following are not to be regarded as an invention for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a discovery, scientific theory or mathematical method;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an aesthetic creation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a scheme, rule or method for performing a mental act, playing a game or doing business, or a program for a computer; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a presentation of information.

subsection.content: Subsection (2) excludes the patentability of the subject-matter or activities referred to in that subsection only to the extent to which a patent or patent application relates to the subject-matter or activities as such.

A method for the treatment of the human or animal body by surgery or therapy, or a diagnostic method practised on the human or animal body, is not to be regarded as an invention that is susceptible of industrial application for the purposes of subsection (1). However, this subsection does not apply to a product, and in particular a substance or composition, for use in any such method.

An invention the publication or working of which would be contrary to public order (“ordre public”) or morality is not a patentable invention. However, the working of an invention is not to be regarded as so contrary only because it is prohibited by any law in force in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: The following are not patentable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a plant or animal variety; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an essentially biological process for the production of plants or animals (other than a microbiological process or its products).

section.name: s9B
section.heading: Novelty

subsection.content: An invention is to be regarded as new if it does not form part of the state of the art.

For a patent application for an invention (subject application), the state of the art comprises everything made available to the public (in Hong Kong or elsewhere), whether by means of a written or oral description, by use or in any other way before the material date of the subject application.

subsection.leadIn: For the subject application, the state of the art also comprises the contents of the following applications for an invention—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a standard patent (R) application as filed—

subparagraph.content: the material date of which is before the material date of the subject application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a designated patent application as filed in a designated patent office—

subparagraph.content: the date of filing of which or, if priority was claimed in the designated patent office, the date of priority accorded in the designated patent office, is before the material date of the subject application; and
which was published by the designated patent office on or after the material date of the subject application;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a standard patent (O) application, as filed and as published—

subparagraph.content: the material date of which is before the material date of the subject application; and
which was published under section 37Q on or after the material date of the subject application; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a short-term patent application—

subparagraph.content: the material date of which is before the material date of the subject application; and
because of which a short-term patent was published under section 118 on or after the material date of the subject application.

subsection.content: For an invention consisting of a substance or composition for use in a method referred to in section 9A(4), if the use of the substance or composition in any such method does not form part of the state of the art, then the fact that the substance or composition forms part of the state of the art does not prevent the invention from being regarded as new.

For an invention consisting of a substance or composition for a specific use in a method referred to in section 9A(4), if the specific use of the substance or composition in any such method does not form part of the state of the art, then the fact that the substance or composition, and any other use of the substance or composition in any such method, form part of the state of the art does not prevent the invention from being regarded as new.

For the purpose of any validity proceedings commenced before the commencement date in relation to a pre-existing patent, section 94 as in force immediately before that date continues to apply to the invention, which is the subject of the patent, as if that section had not been repealed.

For the purpose of any validity proceedings commenced on or after the commencement date in relation to a pre-existing patent, this section applies to the invention, which is the subject of the patent, as if the patent was granted on or after the commencement date.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the Patents (Amendment) Ordinance 2016 (17 of 2016) comes into operation;
pre-existing patent (既有專利) means a standard patent or short-term patent granted before the commencement date;
validity proceedings (有效性法律程序) means any proceedings in which the validity of a patent is put in issue under section 101(1).

section.name: s9C
section.heading: Inventive step

subsection.content: An invention is to be regarded as involving an inventive step if, having regard to the state of the art, it is not obvious to a person skilled in the art.

For the purposes of subsection (1), if the state of the art also comprises the contents of the applications falling within section 9B(3), those applications are not to be considered in deciding whether there has been an inventive step.

section.name: s9D
section.heading: Industrial application
section.content: An invention is to be regarded as susceptible of industrial application if it can be made or used in any kind of industry, including agriculture.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Right to Patent and Mention of Inventor

section.name: s9E
section.heading: Right to patent belongs to inventor

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the right to a patent belongs to the inventor or the inventor’s successor in title.

subsection.leadIn: If the inventor is an employee, the right to the patent is to be determined—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in accordance with the law of the country, territory or area in which the employee is wholly or mainly employed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the identity of the country, territory or area cannot be determined, in accordance with the law of the country, territory or area where the employer’s place of business to which the employee is attached is located.

subsection.content: If 2 or more persons have made an invention independently of each other, the right to a patent for the invention belongs to the person whose patent application has the earlier or earliest material date (as the case requires).
Subsection (3) does not apply to a standard patent application that has not been published under section 20 or 37Q.

section.name: s9F
section.heading: Mention of inventor

subsection.leadIn: The inventor or joint inventors of an invention have a right to be mentioned as such in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any published patent application for the invention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any patent granted for the invention.

subsection.content: If a person has been mentioned as the sole inventor or a joint inventor of an invention because of this section, any other person who alleges that the person ought not to have been so mentioned may request the Registrar to make a finding to that effect.

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar makes such a finding, the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must accordingly amend the register;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must advertise the fact of the amendment by notice in the official journal; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may issue a certificate of the finding to the person who made the request.

section.name: s10
section.heading: General provision regarding applications for standard patents (R)
section.leadIn: This Part shall be construed as providing for the grant of a standard patent (R) for an invention in the following circumstances, and only in those circumstances, namely where— (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 13)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: as the first stage of an application for a standard patent (R), the designated patent application has been recorded in the register and published in Hong Kong in accordance with sections 15 to 22;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a patent has been granted in the designated patent office in pursuance of the designated patent application; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: as the second stage of the application for a standard patent (R), the designated patent has been registered in accordance with sections 23 to 27.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Formality examination of applications for standard patent (R)
section.leadIn: Except as expressly provided to the contrary, nothing in this Part providing for the examination by the Registrar of an application for a standard patent (R) for an invention shall be construed as imposing upon the Registrar any obligation to consider or to have regard to, for the purpose of such examination, any question as to— (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the patentability of the invention;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the applicant is entitled to any priority claimed in the application;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether the invention is properly disclosed in the application; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: whether any requirement under sections 9A, 9B, 9C, 9D, 9E, 9F, 11A, 11B, 11C, 77, 78 or 79 has been complied with. (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 14)

section.name: s11A
section.heading: Non-prejudicial disclosure

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 9B, if the conditions specified in subsection (2) are satisfied, a disclosure of an invention that is the subject of a standard patent (R) application is not to be taken into consideration in determining whether the invention forms part of the state of the art.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the disclosure occurred no earlier than 6 months before the deemed date of filing of the standard patent (R) application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the disclosure was due to, or in consequence of—

subparagraph.content: an evident abuse in relation to the applicant or a proprietor of the invention for the time being; or
the fact that the applicant or a proprietor of the invention for the time being had displayed the invention at a prescribed exhibition or meeting.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2)(b)(ii) applies only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the time of filing the corresponding designated patent application, the applicant stated, in accordance with the law of the designated patent office relating to non-prejudicial disclosure, that the invention had been so displayed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the request to record the designated patent application contains a statement that indicates the prescribed details relating to the disclosure, as required under section 15(2)(f).

section.name: s11B
section.heading: Priority right

subsection.content: Subsection (3) applies if the proprietor of a designated patent application for an invention, on the basis of an earlier application for a patent or other protection for the same invention filed in or for a Paris Convention country, enjoys in the designated patent office a right of priority for the period of 12 months after the date of filing of the earlier application (priority period) under the law of the office.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) also applies if the proprietor, on the basis of an earlier application for a patent or other protection for the same invention filed in or for a country, territory or area that is not a Paris Convention country, enjoys in the designated patent office a right of priority for the priority period consequent on an international agreement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that applies to Hong Kong because either Hong Kong is a party to it or it is applied to Hong Kong by the Central People’s Government of the People’s Republic of China; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that provides for the grant of such priority on the basis of a first filing made in or for that country, territory or area and subject to conditions equivalent to those laid down in the Paris Convention.

subsection.content: The proprietor or the proprietor’s successor in title enjoys, for the purpose of filing a standard patent (R) application for the invention, which is the subject of the designated patent application, the same right of priority as the person enjoys in respect of the designated patent application in the designated patent office.
The right conferred by subsection (3) is subject to sections 15(2)(e) and 23(3)(c).

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to the law of a designated patent office includes the law of the office dealing with the circumstances under which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a filing made in or for a Paris Convention country that is equivalent to a regular national filing under the domestic legislation of that country, or under bilateral or multilateral agreements, gives rise to a right of priority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a subsequent application for a patent for the same subject-matter as in a previous first application and filed in or for the same Paris Convention country is to be considered as the first application for the purpose of determining priority; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: multiple priorities may be claimed in respect of a designated patent application.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: regular national filing (正規國家提交) means a filing that establishes the date on which an application was filed, whatever the outcome of the application may be.

section.name: s11C
section.heading: Effect of priority right

subsection.content: The right of priority conferred by section 11B has the effect that the date of priority enjoyed in the designated patent office is to be regarded as the date of priority of the standard patent (R) application for the purposes of this Ordinance.

A standard patent (R) granted because of a standard patent (R) application in respect of which the proprietor enjoys a right of priority as provided in section 11B is not to be invalidated only because any subject-matter disclosed in the earlier application (that is to say, the application on the basis of which the right of priority is enjoyed in the designated patent office) was made available to the public at any time after the date of filing of the earlier application.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Who may Apply for Standard Patent (R)

section.name: s12
section.heading: Who may apply

subsection.leadIn: The person who may apply for the grant of a standard patent (R) for an invention is— (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 17)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person named as applicant in a designated patent application for a patent for the invention, or his successor in title to the rights under the designated patent application in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in preference to the person mentioned in paragraph (a), the person who is entitled to the property in the invention in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: Subject to any determination under section 13, the applicant for a standard patent (R) for an invention in proceedings before the Registrar shall for the purpose of those proceedings be deemed to be the person entitled to apply for the grant of a patent for that invention under subsection (1). (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 17)

section.name: s13
section.heading: Determination before grant of questions as to who may apply

subsection.leadIn: At any time before a standard patent (R) has been granted for an invention (whether or not an application has been made for a standard patent (R) for the invention)— (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 18)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person may refer to the Registrar or the court the question of whether he is entitled under section 12 (alone or with other persons) to apply for the grant of a standard patent (R) for the invention; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content:
any of 2 or more joint proprietors of an application for
a standard patent (R) for that invention may so refer the question whether any right in or under the application should be transferred or granted to any other person. (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 18)

subsection.content: The Registrar or the court may make such order as he or it thinks fit to give effect to a determination under this section.

subsection.leadIn: Where a question is referred to the Registrar or the court under this section after an application for a standard patent (R) has been filed but before a standard patent (R) is granted in pursuance of the application then the Registrar or the court may, unless the application is withdrawn before the reference is disposed of by the Registrar or the court— (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 18)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: order that the application for a standard patent (R) shall proceed in the name of that person, either solely or jointly with that of any other applicant, instead of in the name of the applicant or any specified applicant; (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 18)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the reference was made by 2 or more persons, order that the application shall proceed in all their names jointly; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make an order transferring or granting any licence or other right in or under the application and give directions to any person for carrying out the provisions of any such order.

subsection.content: Where a person refers a question under subsection (1)(b) relating to an application, any order under subsection (2) may contain directions to any person for transferring or granting any right in or under the application.

If any person to whom directions have been given under subsection (3)(c) or (4) fails to do anything necessary for carrying out any such directions within 14 days after the date of the directions, the Registrar or the court may on application made to him or it by any person in whose favour or on whose reference the directions were given authorize him to do that thing on behalf of the person to whom the directions were given.

subsection.leadIn: No order may be made under subsection (3) unless notice of the reference is given in the prescribed manner to each person who, not being a party to the reference, is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an applicant named in the standard patent (R) application; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person alleged in the reference to have the right to apply for the grant of a standard patent (R) for the invention, whether alone or jointly with any other person, because of any transaction, instrument or event relating to—

subparagraph.content: the invention; or
the standard patent (R) application. (Replaced 17 of 2016 s. 18)

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.content: A person who receives a notice under subsection (6) may oppose the making of the order, which is sought in the reference. (Added 17 of 2016 s. 18)

No directions shall be given under this section so as to affect the mutual rights or obligations of trustees or of the personal representatives of deceased persons, or their rights or obligations as such.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Effect of transfer of application under section 13

subsection.content: Where an order is made or directions are given under section 13 that an application for a standard patent (R) shall proceed in the name of one or some of the original applicants (whether or not it is also to proceed in the name of some other person), any licences or other rights in or under the application shall, subject to the order and any directions under that section, continue in force and be treated as granted by the persons in whose name the application is to proceed. (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 19)

Where an order is made or directions are given under section 13 that an application for a standard patent (R) shall proceed in the name of one or more persons none of whom was an original applicant (on the ground that the original applicant or applicants was or were not entitled to apply under section 12 for the grant of the patent), any licences or other rights in or under the application for a standard patent (R) shall, subject to the order and any directions under that section and subject to subsection (3), lapse on the registration of that person or those persons as the applicant or applicants or, where the application for a standard patent (R) has not been published, on the making of the order. (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 19)

subsection.leadIn: If before a reference to the Registrar or the court under section 13 resulting in the making of any order mentioned in subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the original applicant or any of the applicants, acting in good faith, worked the invention in question in Hong Kong or made effective and serious preparations to do so; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a licensee of the applicant, acting in good faith, worked the invention in Hong Kong or made effective and serious preparations to do so,

subsection.continued: that or those original applicant or applicants or the licensee shall, on making a request within the prescribed period to the person in whose name the application is to proceed, be entitled to be granted a licence (but not an exclusive licence) to continue working or, as the case may be, to work the invention.

subsection.content: Any such licence shall be granted for a reasonable period and on reasonable terms.

Where an order is made as mentioned in subsection (2), the person in whose name the application is to proceed or any person claiming that he is entitled to be granted any such licence may refer to the Registrar or the court the question whether the latter is so entitled and whether any such period is or terms are reasonable, and the Registrar or the court, as appropriate, shall determine the question and may, if he or it considers it appropriate, order the grant of such a licence.
The Registrar or the court may make such order as he or it thinks fit to give effect to a determination under subsection (5).

division.name: D4
division.heading: Request to Record Designated Patent Application

section.name: s15
section.heading: Filing of request to record

subsection.content: A person entitled under section 12(1) to apply for the grant of a standard patent (R) for an invention may, at any time within 6 months after the date of publication of an application in a designated patent office for a patent for the invention, request the Registrar to enter a record of that designated patent application in the register (in this Ordinance referred to as a request to record). (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 21)

subsection.leadIn: Every such request shall be signed by the applicant and be filed with the Registrar in the prescribed manner and shall contain—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: the name and address of the person making the request;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where the person filing the request is a person other than the person named as applicant in the designated patent application, a statement explaining his entitlement to apply for the grant of a standard patent (R) for the invention and prescribed documents supporting that statement; (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 21)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: where priority is claimed under section 11B in respect of a right of priority enjoyed in the designated patent office on the basis of an earlier application as mentioned in that section, a statement that indicates the details of— (Amended 2 of 2001 s. 3; 17 of 2016 s. 21)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date of priority claimed;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the country in which the earlier application was filed;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: where at the time of filing the designated patent application a claim was made in accordance with the law of the designated patent office in respect of any previous disclosure of the invention that was, for the purposes of the law of the designated patent office, a non-prejudicial disclosure, a statement that indicates the prescribed details relating to the previous disclosure; and (Amended 2 of 2001 s. 3)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: an address in Hong Kong for service of documents.

subsection.content: Every such request shall also comply with the requirements of this Ordinance as to the provision of information in, or the translation of documents into, one or both official languages.

A filing fee and an advertisement fee shall be payable within 1 month after the earliest filing with the Registrar of any part of the request to record, and if either fee is not paid within that period or within such further period as may be allowed under subsection (5) the application for a standard patent (R) shall be deemed to be withdrawn. (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 21)
Rules may provide for a period of grace within which a filing fee or advertisement fee that has not been paid within the time limit specified in subsection (4) may still be validly paid.
Subsection (1) shall not apply in respect of a designated patent application published before the date on which the designated patent office was designated under section 8.
Nothing in this section shall preclude a request to record being initiated by documents complying with section 17.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Designated patent application based on international application
section.leadIn: Where a designated patent application is the national phase of an international application under the Patent Cooperation Treaty, then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of section 15(1), and notwithstanding section 5(2)(d)(ii), the date of publication of the designated patent application shall be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date of such publication in the designated patent office as serves to indicate that the international application has validly entered its national phase in the designated patent office; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: such other date as may be prescribed in rules, being a date not earlier than the date on which the international application has validly entered its national phase in the designated patent office;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: reference in section 15(2)(a) to a photocopy of the designated patent application shall be read as reference to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a photocopy of the international application as published by the International Bureau;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a photocopy of any translation of the international application published by the designated patent office; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a photocopy of any publication of information in the designated patent office concerning the international application;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 17(1)(c) shall have effect in such manner as may be specified in rules made for the purposes of this section.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Date of filing of request to record

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2) and section 18(3), the date of filing a request to record shall be the earliest date on which documents filed by the applicant contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an indication that a request is made to record a designated patent application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: information identifying the applicant; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to the designated patent application, including—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the application number assigned to it by the designated patent office; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the publication number (if any) assigned to it by the designated patent office, and the date (if any) of its publication by the designated patent office. (Amended 2 of 2001 s. 5)

subsection.content: If the earliest filing with the Registrar of any part of a request to record occurs more than 6 months after the publication of the corresponding designated patent application the request shall not be dealt with as an application for a standard patent (R). (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 22)

section.name: s18
section.heading: Examination on filing of request to record

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall examine whether—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the request to record satisfies the requirements of section 17(1) for the accordance of a date of filing (minimum requirements);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the filing fee and advertisement fee have been paid in due time.

subsection.content: Subject to section 17(2), if a date of filing cannot be accorded because of deficiencies in the request as regards the minimum requirements, the Registrar shall give the applicant an opportunity to correct the deficiencies in accordance with the rules.
If such deficiencies are not corrected within the prescribed time, the request shall not be dealt with as an application for a standard patent (R).

section.name: s19
section.heading: Examination as to formal requirements of request to record

subsection.content: If a request to record has been accorded a date of filing and is not deemed to be withdrawn by virtue of section 15(4), the Registrar must examine the request to ascertain whether the requirements of section 15(2) and (3) (formal requirements) have been satisfied. (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 24)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: If there are deficiencies in the request as regards the formal requirements that cannot be corrected, the standard patent (R) application must be refused. (Added 17 of 2016 s. 24)

If there are deficiencies in the request as regards the formal requirements that may be corrected, the Registrar must give the applicant an opportunity to correct them in accordance with the rules. (Replaced 17 of 2016 s. 24)

subsection.leadIn: If any deficiencies referred to in subsection (2) are not corrected in accordance with the rules, then except as provided in subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where no steps are taken to correct the deficiencies, the application is to be regarded as being withdrawn; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, the application must be refused. (Replaced 17 of 2016 s. 24)

subsection.content: If a deficiency relating solely to a claim to any right of priority is not duly corrected, then only the right is lost for the application. (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 24)

section.name: s20
section.heading: Publication of request to record

subsection.leadIn: If on an examination under section 19(1) a request to record is found to have satisfied the requirements of section 15(2) and (3), or if on a subsequent examination by the Registrar the deficiencies under section 19(2) are found to have been corrected in accordance with the rules, then the Registrar shall as soon as practicable after such examination, but subject to this section and section 37— (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 25)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: record the designated patent application in the register and enter particulars of the request to record in the register;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: publish the request to record in the prescribed manner;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: advertise the fact of such publication and entry by notice in the official journal; and (Amended 2 of 2001 s. 6; 2 of 2001 s. 14)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: inform the applicant of the publication of the request to record.

subsection.leadIn: A request to record shall not be published if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the completion of preparations for publication, it has been finally refused or withdrawn or has been deemed to have been withdrawn; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the filing fee or advertisement fee has not been paid.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b) the request to record shall include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the designated patent application, including the description, the claims, any drawings and any search report or abstract published by the designated patent office and filed in the request to record;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the names of the proprietor and (if different) the inventor.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Registrar may publish additional matters
section.content: In publishing a request to record under section 20(1)(b), the Registrar may publish such matters constituting or relating to the request which in the Registrar’s opinion it is desirable to publish in addition to the matters specified in section 20(3).

section.name: s22
section.heading: Provision for request to record in the event of a divisional designated patent application

subsection.leadIn: Where in an application for a standard patent (R)— (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a request to record has been published under section 20 and has not been refused, withdrawn or deemed to be withdrawn; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant for the corresponding designated patent application or his successor in title has filed in the designated patent office a divisional patent application (divisional designated patent application), that is to say, an application for a patent which— (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 26)

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: has as its date of filing the date of filing of the corresponding designated patent application; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: enjoys the same benefit of any right of priority as the corresponding designated patent application,

subsection.continued: the applicant may within 6 months after the date of publication of the divisional designated patent application or publication of the request to record under this Ordinance, whichever is the later, request the Registrar to enter a record of that divisional designated patent application in the register.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 103(1), where a request to record a divisional designated patent application is filed under this section— (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it shall be deemed to have been filed on the date of filing of the earlier request to record and the application for a standard patent (R) shall have the benefit of any right of priority; (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 26)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (a), the provisions of this Ordinance shall apply to such a request as they apply to a request to record filed under section 15(1).

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of the application of the other provisions of this Ordinance to this section—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: any reference in those other provisions to a corresponding designated patent shall be read as a reference to the designated patent granted in pursuance of the divisional designated patent application.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Filing of request for registration and grant

subsection.leadIn: Where in an application for a standard patent (R)— (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a designated patent application has been recorded in the register and a request to record has been published and the request to record is not refused or deemed withdrawn or abandoned; and (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 28)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a patent has been granted in the designated patent office in pursuance of the designated patent application,

subsection.continued: the applicant or his successor in title may, subject to subsection (2), request the Registrar to register the designated patent so granted and to grant a standard patent (R) for the invention shown in the published specification of the designated patent (in this Ordinance referred to as a request for registration and grant). (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 28)

subsection.content: A request for registration and grant under subsection (1) shall be made within 6 months after the date of grant of the designated patent by the designated patent office or publication of the request to record, whichever is the later.

subsection.leadIn: Every such request shall be filed with the Registrar in the prescribed manner and shall contain—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the person filing the request is a person other than the person named in the register as the applicant for a standard patent (R) for the invention, a statement explaining the first-mentioned person’s entitlement to apply for the grant of a standard patent (R) for the invention and prescribed documents supporting that statement; (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 28)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the request to record contains a statement under section 15(2)(e) to the effect that priority is claimed on the basis of a right of priority claimed in the designated patent office, such copies as may be prescribed of the documents filed in the designated patent office claiming and supporting such right of priority.

subsection.content: Every such request shall also comply with the requirements of this Ordinance as to the provision of information in, or the translation of documents into, one or both official languages.

A filing fee and an advertisement fee shall be payable within 1 month after the earliest filing of a part of the request for registration and grant, and if either fee is not paid within that period or within such further period as may be allowed under subsection (6) the application for a standard patent (R) shall be deemed to be withdrawn. (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 28)
Rules may provide for a period of grace within which a filing fee or advertisement fee that has not been paid within the time limit specified in subsection (5) may still be validly paid.
Nothing in this section shall preclude a request for registration and grant being initiated in accordance with section 24.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Date of filing request for registration and grant

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2) and section 25(2) and (4), the date of filing of a request for registration and grant shall be the earliest date on which documents filed by the applicant contain— (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 29)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an indication that a request is made for the registration of a designated patent and the grant of a standard patent (R); (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 29)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: information identifying the applicant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the publication number assigned to the designated patent by the designated patent office, and the date of its publication; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the publication number assigned to the request to record by the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: If the earliest filing with the Registrar of any part of a request for registration and grant occurred more than 6 months after the later of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of grant of the designated patent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: publication of the request to record in accordance with section 20,

subsection.continued: then the application shall be deemed to be withdrawn.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Examination on filing of request for registration and grant

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall examine whether—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the filing fee and advertisement fee have been paid in due time.

subsection.content: If there are deficiencies in the request as regards the requirements of section 24(1) that cannot be corrected, the standard patent (R) application must be refused. (Replaced 17 of 2016 s. 30)

Subject to section 24(2), if there are deficiencies in the request as regards the requirements of section 24(1) that may be corrected, the Registrar must give the applicant an opportunity to correct them in accordance with the rules. (Replaced 17 of 2016 s. 30)

subsection.leadIn: If any deficiencies referred to in subsection (3) are not corrected in accordance with the rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where no steps are taken to correct the deficiencies, the application is to be regarded as being withdrawn; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, the application must be refused. (Added 17 of 2016 s. 30)

section.name: s26
section.heading: Examination as to formal requirements of the request for registration and grant

subsection.content: If a request for registration and grant has been accorded a date of filing and is not deemed to be withdrawn by virtue of section 23(5), the Registrar must examine the request to ascertain whether the requirements of section 23(3) and (4) (formal requirements) have been satisfied. (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 31)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: If there are deficiencies in the request as regards the formal requirements that cannot be corrected, the standard patent (R) application must be refused. (Added 17 of 2016 s. 31)

If there are deficiencies in the request as regards the formal requirements that may be corrected, the Registrar must give the applicant an opportunity to correct them in accordance with the rules. (Replaced 17 of 2016 s. 31)

subsection.leadIn: If any deficiencies referred to in subsection (2) are not corrected in accordance with the rules, then except as provided in subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where no steps are taken to correct the deficiencies, the application is to be regarded as being withdrawn; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, the application must be refused. (Replaced 17 of 2016 s. 31)

subsection.content: If a deficiency relating solely to a claim to any right of priority is not duly corrected, then only the right is lost for the application. (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 31)

section.name: s27
section.heading: Registration of designated patent and grant of standard patent (R)

subsection.leadIn: If on examination under section 26(1) a request for registration and grant is found to have satisfied the requirements of section 23(3) and (4) or if on a subsequent examination the deficiencies under section 26(2) are found to have been corrected in accordance with the rules, then the Registrar shall as soon as practicable after such examination, but subject to section 37— (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 32)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: register the designated patent by making an appropriate entry in the register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: grant a standard patent (R) for the invention shown in the published specification of the designated patent as filed under section 23(3)(a) and issue a certificate of grant to that effect.

subsection.content: A standard patent (R) shall not be granted under this section unless the filing fee and advertisement fee specified in section 23 and any other fees payable under the preceding provisions of this Part have been paid.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after a standard patent (R) has been granted under this section the Registrar shall— (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 32)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publish in the prescribed manner the specification of the patent, the names of the proprietor and, if different, the inventor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: send the certificate of grant issued under subsection (1)(b) to the proprietor; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: advertise the fact of such grant by notice in the official journal. (Amended 2 of 2001 s. 14)

subsection.content: In publishing under subsection (3)(a) any matters specified in that subsection, the Registrar may publish in addition such other matters constituting or relating to the patent which in his opinion it is desirable to publish.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Further Processing and Restoration of Rights

section.name: s28
section.heading: Further processing of application for standard patent (R)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this section, where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for a standard patent (R), or any part of an application, is refused or is deemed to be or regarded as being withdrawn following the applicant’s failure to comply with a time limit under this Part (including any time limit set by the Registrar); and (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 34)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has by notice filed with the Registrar requested reinstatement of the application or part of the application,

subsection.continued: then the legal consequence of the failure to comply with the time limit, as provided under the Ordinance, shall not ensue or, if it has already ensued, shall be retracted.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be in writing and shall be filed within 2 months after such refusal or withdrawal; (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 34)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not be deemed to be filed unless the additional prescribed fee has been paid; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall not be deemed to be filed unless the omission which constituted the failure to comply with a time limit has been made good.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply to an application that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is refused under section 25(2) or (4)(b); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is deemed to be or regarded as being withdrawn under section 15(4), 23(5), 24(2), 25(4)(a) or 33(2). (Replaced 17 of 2016 s. 34)

subsection.content: The Registrar may by regulation amend the period specified in subsection (2)(a) within which a notice under this section shall be filed.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Restoration of rights

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this section, where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an applicant for a standard patent (R) has failed to comply with a time limit under this Part (including any time limit set by the Registrar); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar is satisfied that the failure to comply with the time limit occurred in spite of the applicant having taken all reasonable care required by the circumstances,

subsection.continued: then upon application by the applicant to the Registrar under this section for restoration of his rights lost—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: if the standard patent (R) application is refused, or is deemed to be or regarded as being withdrawn, as a direct consequence of the failure to comply with the time limit, the refusal or withdrawal is of no effect and the application is to be regarded for the purposes of proceedings under this Part as if there had been no such failure;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: any right or means of redress lost by the applicant as a direct consequence of the failure to comply with the time limit is to be restored to the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: An application under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: shall be in writing and shall be made not later than—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: 1 year after the expiry of the time limit referred to in subsection (1)(a); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: 2 months after the removal of the cause of non-compliance with the time limit,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not be deemed to be filed unless the additional prescribed fee has been paid; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall not be deemed to be made unless the omission which constituted the failure to comply with a time limit has been made good.

subsection.content: Where prior to the refusal or withdrawal of the application mentioned in subsection (1)(i) the request to record had been published under section 20, the Registrar shall advertise in the official journal notice of any application under subsection (1). (Amended 2 of 2001 s. 14)
The Registrar may by regulation amend the periods specified in subsection (2)(a) within which an application under this section shall be filed.

This section does not apply to any failure to comply with a time limit under section 15 (except as regards any time limit specified for the purposes of section 15(3)), 17(2), 18, 19, 22, 23(5), 24(2), 25(4), 31(1), 32(1) or 33(2) or (4).

section.name: s30
section.heading: Effect of restoration of rights under section 29

subsection.content: The effect of a restoration under section 29 is as follows.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, during the period between the loss of rights referred to in section 29(1) and the advertisement in the official journal of notice of the application for restoration under section 29(3)— (Amended 2 of 2001 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does in good faith an act which would constitute an infringement of the applicant’s rights under the published application for a standard patent (R) if those rights had not been lost; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: makes in good faith effective and serious preparations to do such an act,

subsection.continued: has the rights specified in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The rights referred to in subsection (2) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the right to continue to do or, as the case may be, to do the act referred to in subsection (2);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if such act was done or preparations had been made to do it in the course of a business—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of an individual—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the right to assign the right to do it or to transmit such right on death; or

subparagraph.name: B
ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a body corporate, the right to assign the right to do it or to transmit such right on the body’s dissolution,

subsection.continued: and the doing of that act by virtue of this subsection shall not amount to an infringement of the applicant’s rights under the published application for a standard patent (R) concerned.

subsection.content: The rights specified in subsection (3) shall not include the right to grant a licence to any person to do an act referred to in subsection (2).

Where a product is disposed of to another in exercise of a right conferred by subsection (3), that other and any person claiming through him may deal with the product in the same way as if it had been disposed of by the applicant in the standard patent (R) application.

division.name: D7
division.heading: Provisions on Standard Patent (R) Applications before Grant

section.name: s31
section.heading: Amendment of application for standard patent (R)

subsection.content: Subject to this section and sections 36 and 103(2), an applicant for a standard patent (R) may at any time before a standard patent (R) is granted pursuant to the application, in accordance with the prescribed conditions, amend the application of his own volition. (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 38)

subsection.leadIn: No amendment may be made under subsection (1) to the title of the invention, the abstract, a priority claim or any claim, description or drawing unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application has been published; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amendment is an amendment that has been made to the corresponding designated patent application.

subsection.content: Upon receipt of particulars of an amendment filed in accordance with subsections (1) and (2) the Registrar shall record the amendment.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Withdrawal of application

subsection.content: Subject to section 36, an applicant for a standard patent (R) may at any time before a standard patent (R) is granted pursuant to the application withdraw in writing his application and any such withdrawal may not be revoked.

subsection.leadIn: Where a standard patent (R) application is withdrawn under this section, or is deemed or regarded under this Ordinance to have been withdrawn, or is refused under any provision of this Ordinance, then— (Amended 17 of 2016 s. 39)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the applicant shall continue to enjoy the right of priority under section 11B which he enjoyed immediately before such withdrawal or refusal;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no other right may be claimed under this Ordinance in relation to the application.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Maintaining application for standard patent (R)

subsection.content: This section applies to an application for a standard patent (R) which has been published but in which no request has been made for registration and grant under section 23.

If it is desired to maintain a standard patent (R) application to which this section applies for a further year after the expiry of the 5th or any succeeding year from the date specified in subsection (3), the applicant shall, before the expiry of that 5th or succeeding year (as the case may be), but not earlier than a date 3 months before that expiry, apply to the Registrar in the prescribed manner for the maintenance of the patent application (maintenance application) and pay the prescribed fee (maintenance fee) and a standard patent (R) application to which this section applies shall be deemed to be withdrawn and abandoned at the expiry of that 5th or succeeding year if the maintenance application is not so made or the maintenance fee is not so paid.

The date specified for the purpose of subsection (2) is the anniversary of the date of filing the corresponding designated patent application first occurring after the date of publishing the request to record.

If, within 6 months after the end of the period specified in subsection (2) for the making of a maintenance application, an application is made under subsection (2) and the maintenance fee and any prescribed additional fee are paid in the prescribed manner then the standard patent (R) application shall be treated as if it had not been withdrawn or abandoned.

subsection.leadIn: If statements contained in the maintenance application indicate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that as at a date specified in the application, being a date not earlier than 1 month before the date of making the application—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the designated patent application has not been withdrawn or abandoned for the purposes of the law of the designated patent office; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: there has been no final refusal by the designated patent office to grant a patent pursuant to the designated patent application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as at the date specified for the purposes of paragraph (a) a patent had not been granted pursuant to the designated patent application; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a patent has been granted pursuant to the designated patent application, and the date of such grant is a date within 6 months before the date of the application,

subsection.continued: the Registrar shall, subject to subsection (9), maintain the standard patent (R) application.
